page.title: 08BOSLEY VILLAGE CHURCH
page.content: Details of Bosley Church can be found in Raymond Richard's book on old Cheshire Churches.The present buildings dates from 1777.It is mainley made of brick's in Flemish bond but the tower is sandstone.This is beginning to show signs of corrosion from the weather.The Church is oil heated.Because of the expence it is rarely heated except on sundays. From the 1st January 1985 these new parochial fees aplly.A Baptism costs Â£3 A wedding costs Â£48.50 The total costs of a Burial plus service Â£54 A vase on a grave must measure 300mm x 200mm x 200mm A headstone placed vertically or horizontally must measure 450mm x 450mm The present vicar is Reverend Peter Barratt.On average only 8 people attend a service a day.Expenditure on the church is Â£2.570 per year.
